context_negative.name: Amiloride
context_negative.why: Blocks Na+/H+ exchange, preventing ruffle closure and cup formation required for macropinocytosis.

context_negative.name: EIPA (5-(N-ethyl-N-isopropyl) amiloride)
context_negative.why: Potent derivative of amiloride that specifically inhibits macropinocytosis by disrupting Na+/H+ exchange.

context_negative.name: Cytochalasin D
context_negative.why: Binds to actin filaments and blocks polymerization, preventing ruffle and cup formation.

context_negative.name: Latrunculin B
context_negative.why: Sequesters actin monomers, preventing actin filament assembly required for macropinocytosis.

context_negative.name: Wortmannin
context_negative.why: Blocks PI3K signaling, which is essential for closure of macropinocytic cups.

context_negative.name: LY294002
context_negative.why: Another PI3K inhibitor that reduces PIP3 signaling and prevents macropinosome closure.

context_negative.name: Rottlerin
context_negative.why: Reported to block macropinocytosis through PKC-dependent actin remodeling.

context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 2.7 µM (in H1299 cells)

context_negative.dose: Low micromolar (variable; known to inhibit CIE too)

context_negative.name: Dynasore
context_negative.type: Small molecule inhibitor of dynamin GTPase
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 15 µM for dynamin 1

context_negative.name: Dyngo 4a
context_negative.dose: Sub-micromolar to micromolar (varies by cell type)

context_negative.name: Chlorpromazine
context_negative.type: Antipsychotic (phenothiazine class); inhibits clathrin coat assembly

context_negative.name: Monodansylcadaverine (MDC)
context_negative.type: Small molecule; inhibits transglutaminase-dependent steps of CME

gate_core.why: Core structural protein required for the formation of caveolae; its knockdown or inhibition disrupts internalization of pathogens like Listeria monocytogenes and Brucella spp.
Muscle-specific isoform involved in caveolae formation in muscle cells; included as a core structural protein though context-specific.
Essential for caveolae stability through binding to phospholipids like PtdIns(4,5)P2 and PtdSer; loss leads to disruption of caveolar structure.
A GTPase required for the scission of caveolae from the membrane; essential for vesicle formation in caveolin-mediated endocytosis.

regulators.why: Syndapin I-Critical for the membrane deformation and caveolae generation; also recruits Dynamin-2 and interacts with EHD proteins.
Helps stabilize caveolae neck region; overlaps functionally with PACSIN1.
Filamin A-Actin cross-linking protein required for recruitment of CAV1 to membrane invaginations during bacterial protrusion engulfment.
mDia1-Required to recruit Filamin A and facilitate actin polymerization during membrane deformation in caveolin-mediated endocytosis.
Epsin-1:Assists in membrane bending and invagination during caveolae formation; contributes to engulfment of bacterial protrusions.
MLCK: Myosin light chain kinase involved in junctional protein endocytosis via caveolin-dependent mechanism, important in Listeria entry.
SRC-family kinases: phosphorylate CAV1 to trigger fission
SRC-family kinases: phosphorylate CAV1 to trigger fission
Actin alpha isoform contributing to cortical actin anchoring of caveolae
Smooth-muscle actin supporting caveolaetoactin linkage and contractility
beta-actin forming cortical networks that anchor and remodel caveolae
Cardiac actin isoform listed for actin network composition at caveolae
gamma-actin supporting cortical actin used by caveolae
Smooth-muscle gamma-actin variant contributing to caveolar actin structures
Ser/Thr kinase implicated in microtubule-mediated long-range trafficking of caveolae/caveosomes
Ligand whose stimulation can trigger caveolae internalization
EGF receptor caveola-associated receptor whose signaling can induce caveolar uptake
Filamin B actin cross-linker anchoring/stabilizing caveolae
Filamin C paralog supporting caveolae anchoring to the cytoskeleton
Insulin receptor receptor whose activation can induce caveolar endocytosis
Intersectin-1 scaffold for endocytic signaling complexes linked to caveolae
MAP3K2 kinase downstream of caveolar signaling stimuli
PKCalpha modulates signaling and caveolar trafficking/internalization
PTP1B protein tyrosine phosphatase regulating receptor/caveolin-1 phosphorylation states
Co-localizes with CAV1 and contributes to the stabilization of caveolae; necessary for cell-to-cell spread in Listeria monocytogenes infection.
SRBC: adapter/modulator
MURC: tissue-specific cavin

context_negative.name: Genistein
context_negative.dose: 50-200 µM; inhibits Src-family kinases and internalization

gate_core.why: A small Rho GTPase that regulates actin polymerization and is essential for CLIC/GEEC vesicle formation, trafficking, and maturation.
activates ARF1 to tune CDC42 cycling at PM
A small GTPase that initiates CLIC formation by recruiting necessary components at the plasma membrane.
returns CDC42 to cycling state for carrier formation
RhoGAP/BAR/SH3 protein central to CLIC/GEEC tubules
ARP2: branched actin for curvature and vesicle formation
ARP3: branched actin for curvature and vesicle formation
IRSp53: membrane/actin coupling in CIE families incl. CLIC/GEEC

regulators.why: A guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) that activates Arf1, thus initiating the cascade that maintains Cdc42 cycling.
A RhoGAP protein that inactivates Cdc42, returning it to a cycling state and balancing actin dynamics.
Multidomain protein with a BAR, SH3, and RhoGAP domain; colocalizes with CLIC/GEEC carriers and regulates Cdc42 activity and membrane curvature.
Galectin-3: An extracellular lectin that clusters glycosylated cargo and lipids, initiating membrane curvature required for CLIC formation.
Protein Interacting with C Kinase 1, involved in Arp2/3 regulation and thereby affects actin dynamics required for CLIC/GEEC vesicle formation.
Small GTPase that regulates the fusion of GEECs with early sorting endosomes, affecting downstream trafficking but not initial internalization.
Phosphoinositide 3-kinase facilitates membrane trafficking and maturation of endosomes; important for fusion of GEECs but not for carrier formation.
Although not required for CLIC formation (which is dynamin-independent), it is involved in **membrane recycling from GEECs** in certain cell types.
Mechanotransducer protein that regulates membrane tension; modulates CLIC/GEEC activity under mechanical stress but is not a core component.
A glycosylated transmembrane protein and cargo of the pathway; it clusters via galectin-3 but its presence is not required to activate the pathway.
These receptors are cargo for CLIC/GEEC and may influence clustering and curvature, but are not required for pathway formation or vesicle scission.
These receptors are cargo for CLIC/GEEC and may influence clustering and curvature, but are not required for pathway formation or vesicle scission.
Galectin-1: Like galectin-3, it can assist in clustering glycosylated cargo, but its role is context-dependent and not essential in all cell types.
Modulates fission of macropinosomes but also affects some aspects of membrane remodeling; not essential but may crosstalk with CLIC/GEEC.

gate_core.why: Endophilin A1: Essential for membrane curvature generation, cargo selection, and membrane scission during FEME; no FEME occurs without their combined presence.
Endophilin A2: Essential for membrane curvature generation, cargo selection, and membrane scission during FEME; no FEME occurs without their combined presence.
Endophilin A3: Essential for membrane curvature generation, cargo selection, and membrane scission during FEME; no FEME occurs without their combined presence.
Dynamin 1: GTPase required for membrane scission; recruited by Endophilin to bud FEME carriers.
Dynamin 2: GTPase required for membrane scission; recruited by Endophilin to bud FEME carriers.
N WASP: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
WAVE regulatory complex (WRC):Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
WAVE regulatory complex (WRC): Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
WAVE regulatory complex (WRC):Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
CYFIP family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
CYFIP family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
NCKAP family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
NCKAP family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
ABI family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
ABI family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
ABI family: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
BRK1: Supports membrane curvature and scission; required for FEME carrier formation and transport.
Catalytic subunit of Class I PI3K - required to phosphorylate PIP2 into PIP3, triggering FEME activatio
Catalytic subunit of Class I PI3K - required to phosphorylate PIP2 into PIP3, triggering FEME activatio
Catalytic subunit of Class I PI3K - required to phosphorylate PIP2 into PIP3, triggering FEME activatio

regulators.why: SHIP1: Required for the priming cycle by converting Pi(3,4,5)P3 to Pi(3,4)P2 to recruit Lamellipodin and Endophilin.
SHIP2: Required for the priming cycle by converting Pi(3,4,5)P3 to Pi(3,4)P2 to recruit Lamellipodin and Endophilin.
Initiates the priming cycle of FEME by recruiting FBP17/CIP4 to plasma membrane.
phosphoregulation of endophilin N BAR; modulates membrane binding
FBP17: FEME priming protein
CIP4: FEME priming protein
Lamellipodin: FEME priming protein
FEME priming protein
Cdc42 GAP that terminates FEME priming specifically; its overexpression suppresses FEME without major effects on CME.
Amphiphysin II: FEME component/assistant
Phosphorylates Dynamin-1 at Ser778 to inhibit its recruitment to Endophilin and block FEME.
Phosphorylates Dynamin-1 at Ser774 and is inactivated by AKT/ERK upon receptor stimulation to allow FEME activation.
Phosphorylates Endophilin and influences FEME initiation; involved in relieving Endophilin auto-inhibition.
Phosphorylates Endophilin at sites that impair its membrane-binding ability, thus inhibiting FEME.
N-BAR protein recruited to FEME carriers to assist in scission and dynein recruitment.
Motor protein regulating FEME carrier transport, but not essential for vesicle scission or internalization itself
(Oligophrenin-1): Acts as a GAP terminating Cdc42 activity in FEME priming; specifically impacts FEME, not CME.

context_negative.name: Mdivi-1
context_negative.type: Dynamin-related GTPase inhibitor (Drp1 selective, off-targets dynamin)

context_negative.name: GSK2578215A
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 10 nM (LRRK2-G2019S mutant)

gate_core.why: RhoA regulates actomyosin contractility and has been shown to inhibit clathrin-mediated endocytosis; activated RhoA delays EGF receptor trafficking to lysosomes.
Cdc42 is essential for actin comet tail formation and vesicle propulsion in both endocytic and exocytic pathways, and regulates apical/basolateral trafficking in polarized epithelial cells.
Rac1 promotes macropinocytosis and phagocytosis by driving actin polymerization through the Arp2/3 complex, but also inhibits clathrin-mediated endocytosis.

regulators.why: A downstream effector of RhoA, ROCK1 mediates actomyosin contractility which may influence vesicle scission or cortical tension during endocytosis.
DIA1 (mDia1): A RhoA effector coordinating actin and microtubule networks, possibly impacting vesicle transport and membrane tension.
Activated by RhoB, PRK1 is involved in trafficking of internalized EGF receptor by slowing its movement toward lysosomes.
A Rac/Cdc42 target required for macropinocytosis; activated PAK1 stimulates actin remodeling linked to vesicle uptake.
(Synaptojanin 2) Effector of Rac1 that regulates clathrin-mediated endocytosis by modifying phosphoinositides and potentially uncoating vesicles.
(Dynamin 2) Interacts with cortactin and syndapin to promote membrane scission and is linked to actin-driven vesicle propulsion via Arp2/3 complex.
CORTACTIN: Binds Arp2/3 and actin, mediating actin polymerization at endocytic sites; interacts with dynamin.
GEF-H1: A RhoGEF localized to microtubules; may activate RhoA upon microtubule depolymerization and regulate spatial activation of Rho signaling.
N-WASP: Activated by Cdc42 and dynamin, N-WASP drives Arp2/3-mediated actin polymerization to form vesicle-propelling actin tails.
(part of Arp2/3 complex) Effector of Rac and Cdc42 via WASP/WAVE, it nucleates branched actin networks crucial for vesicle formation and movement.
Cdc42-interacting scaffold protein localized at Golgi; may help organize actin, but dispensable for vesicle internalization.

context_negative.name: Y-27632
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 140 nM for ROCK1

context_negative.name: Fasudil (HA-1077)
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 330 nM for ROCK2

context_negative.name: Rhosin
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 5.2 µM for RhoA activation

context_negative.name: Exoenzyme C3 (from Clostridium botulinum)
context_negative.dose: Inhibitory at 1-to-5 µg/mL in cultured cells

context_negative.name: NSC23766
context_negative.type: Small molecule Rac1 inhibitor (indirectly affects RhoA via cross-regulation)
context_negative.dose: IC50 almost equal to 50 µM for Rac1-GEF binding

gate_core.why: Central small GTPase that directly regulates actin polymerization via WASptoArp2/3 to drive clathrin-independent endocytosis and vesicle scission.
WASp: Effector of Cdc42; relieves autoinhibition and activates the Arp2/3 complex, enabling branched actin formation required for vesicle scission.
Arp2: Actin nucleator downstream of Cdc42toWASp; required to generate branched actin filaments that deform membranes and support vesicle budding and fission.
Arp3: Actin nucleator downstream of Cdc42toWASp; required to generate branched actin filaments that deform membranes and support vesicle budding and fission.
Required for vesicle scission at adherens junctions and other sites where Cdc42 regulates endocytosis.
Cip4: Cdc42-interacting F-BAR protein that activates WASp and promotes Arp2/3-mediated actin assembly, facilitating vesicle scission.

regulators.why: Forms a complex with Cdc42 and aPKC to regulate endocytosis and recycling of clathrin-dependent and independent cargo, especially in epithelial polarity contexts.
aPKC: Kinase activated by Cdc42toPar6; regulates apical endocytosis and recycling, influencing trafficking of Crumbs and adherens junction components.
Par3: In some contexts (C. elegans, Drosophila embryo) cooperates with Cdc42toPar6toaPKC to regulate apical endocytosis and recycling of clathrin-independent cargo.
Crumbs: An apical determinant regulated by Cdc42; its trafficking defects destabilize adherens junctions in Drosophila neuroectoderm, but Cdc42 endocytosis can still occur without it.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
DE-cadherin: Core adhesion molecule that accumulates abnormally when Cdc42/Par complex is disrupted; influences junctional stability but is not required to initiate Cdc42-mediated uptake.
Lgl (Lethal giant larvae): Can interact with Par6toaPKC to exclude Par3; modulates polarity and trafficking in certain contexts but is not universally required for Cdc42-driven endocytosis.
Lgl (Lethal giant larvae): Can interact with Par6toaPKC to exclude Par3; modulates polarity and trafficking in certain contexts but is not universally required for Cdc42-driven endocytosis.
Annexin 2: Recruits Cdc42 to PIP2-rich apical membranes in MDCK cysts, helping lumen formation; enhances spatial targeting but is not essential for the mechanism itself.
SCAR/WAVE: Alternative actin nucleation regulator that works with Cip4; contributes to endosome dynamics in Drosophila but is not indispensable for Cdc42-mediated endocytosis.
SCAR/WAVE: Alternative actin nucleation regulator that works with Cip4; contributes to endosome dynamics in Drosophila but is not indispensable for Cdc42-mediated endocytosis.
SCAR/WAVE: Alternative actin nucleation regulator that works with Cip4; contributes to endosome dynamics in Drosophila but is not indispensable for Cdc42-mediated endocytosis.

context_negative.why: Acts as a negative regulator of Cdc42→Par6→aPKC at adherens junctions; its loss increases endocytosis and disrupts apical tension, while Cdc42 depletion rescues Rho1 mutant phenotypes.
A GAP that inactivates Cdc42 at tight junctions; its knockdown leads to Cdc42 hyperactivation and junctional defects, indicating it restrains excessive Cdc42-driven endocytosis.

context_negative.name: Phenoxybenzamine
context_negative.dose: Not specified (identified in screen as inhibitor of macropinocytosis)

context_negative.name: Amiloride
context_negative.type: Ion transport inhibitor / Na⁺/H⁺ exchanger blocker
context_negative.dose: Commonly used ~50 µM in cell assays

context_negative.name: EIPA (ethylisopropylamiloride)
context_negative.type: Ion transport inhibitor / Na⁺/H⁺ exchanger blocker
context_negative.dose: Commonly used ~50 µM in cell assays

gate_core.why: Master small GTPase required for clathrin-dependent and clathrin-independent endocytosis, regulating receptor and ligand uptake.
Generates PI(4,5)P2 at the plasma membrane after activation by ARF6, essential for coated pit assembly and scission.
Produces phosphatidic acid, which cooperates with PIP5K to promote vesicle budding and fission.
Produces phosphatidic acid, which cooperates with PIP5K to promote vesicle budding and fission.

regulators.why: EFA6 family: Specific GEFs that directly activate ARF6 by promoting GDPtoGTP exchange, initiating endocytosis and recycling.
EFA6 family: Specific GEFs that directly activate ARF6 by promoting GDPtoGTP exchange, initiating endocytosis and recycling.
EFA6 family: Specific GEFs that directly activate ARF6 by promoting GDPtoGTP exchange, initiating endocytosis and recycling.
EFA6 family: Specific GEFs that directly activate ARF6 by promoting GDPtoGTP exchange, initiating endocytosis and recycling.
ARNO (Cytohesin-2, PSCD2): Plasma membrane GEF that activates ARF6 in response to signals, triggering downstream Rac1 activation and endocytosis.
BRAG2 (ARF GEP100): ARF6-specific GEF required for integrin endocytosis and recycling, crucial for pathway activation in adhesion contexts.
NM23-H1: Supplies local GTP for dynamin during vesicle fission, enhances clathrin-mediated uptake but pathway can still occur without it.
ARF6 GAP that interacts with clathrin heavy chain to regulate vesicle uncoating; modulates efficiency but not initiation.
ARF6 GAP that regulates transferrin and beta1 integrin recycling; affects recycling but not initial uptake.
Exocyst complex (Sec10, Arfophilin-1/2): Tethers ARF6-derived recycling vesicles to plasma membrane and cleavage furrow; important for trafficking but not required for endocytosis initiation.
Exocyst complex (Sec10, Arfophilin-1/2): Tethers ARF6-derived recycling vesicles to plasma membrane and cleavage furrow; important for trafficking but not required for endocytosis initiation.
Exocyst complex (Sec10, Arfophilin-1/2): Tethers ARF6-derived recycling vesicles to plasma membrane and cleavage furrow; important for trafficking but not required for endocytosis initiation.
Small GTPase activated downstream of ARF6 to remodel actin; influences endocytosis efficiency and cell migration but not strictly required for uptake.

context_negative.name: Rasarfin
context_negative.dose: IC50 / potency not fully disclosed for ARF6 alone (inhibits GPCR internalization via ARF6)

context_negative.name: NAV-2729
context_negative.dose: Inhibition in µM range (complex target profile including ARF regulators)
context_negative.evidence: J. Biol. Chem. 2023: The small molecule inhibitor NAV-2729 has a complex target profile including multiple ADP-ribosylation factor regulatory proteins.
